Apple Podcasts Preview

Get iTunes on iOS, Android, Mac, and Windows

Learn More

4 episodes

Most musicians would love to have a moment that defined their career. A moment when they find something that sets them apart and pushes them forward into unknown territory. If, as an artist, you’re lucky enough to have that moment, we - as the listening public - can only hope somebody was there to press record. If that moment exists in a song, we want to hear every bit of it. But what about what came before. And after.

This season on “The Jump”, acclaimed singer / songwriter Shirley Manson (Garbage) sits down with seven of the most influential musicians of the last two decades (Neko Case, Esperanza Spalding, Big Boi, Dave 1, Courtney love, Karen O and Perfume Genius) to discuss the song that represents their artistic moment of truth and the impact that song had on both their careers, and their lives.

The Jump with Shirley Manson Mailchimp

    • Music

Most musicians would love to have a moment that defined their career. A moment when they find something that sets them apart and pushes them forward into unknown territory. If, as an artist, you’re lucky enough to have that moment, we - as the listening public - can only hope somebody was there to press record. If that moment exists in a song, we want to hear every bit of it. But what about what came before. And after.

This season on “The Jump”, acclaimed singer / songwriter Shirley Manson (Garbage) sits down with seven of the most influential musicians of the last two decades (Neko Case, Esperanza Spalding, Big Boi, Dave 1, Courtney love, Karen O and Perfume Genius) to discuss the song that represents their artistic moment of truth and the impact that song had on both their careers, and their lives.

Jason Navy Chef , 07/06/2019

Love Music 22yrs Retired Disabled Veteran I have a passion always wanted to follow

Love this podcast ! After 22 yrs of Military service. Disabled veteran, survived many death like experiences and surgeries. Being a father of a 28 yr old daughter, a 7 yr old granddaughter, coming out as a gay Navy Chief was a life changing experience. So god knows music helped me through many experiences and from a country childhood of West Virginia now living in San Diego Ca I love this podcast, with ptsd and trauma one thing that inspired me to thank god was music and listening I can after few times remember every word of a song fast ! So I listened to this podcast love the way her voice and passion really inspires me ! Thanks hope my dream comes true ! Thanks Jason Simmons
USN Chief Retired Disabled Veteran San Diego California 92104 619-794-2667🏳️‍🌈🎧♥️👍👍

Arielle Levy , 07/04/2019

Very relatable

Found the jump because I'm a hrishikesh hirway fan and read that he's executive producing. I'm not a songwriter but I can so relate to the idea of having that moment when you send your work into the world and it changes your life and you didn't realize it. I have ADHD so <3 that the episodes are short so far.

curveboy68 , 06/27/2019

What a opening episode

I was always drawn to this song after Shirley mentioned perfume genius on social media awhile back. It was such a joy to find out who was behind this song and how it came to be. Looking forward to other episodes
